1.title: The TARDIS Episode
1.plot: Chelsea and Roe debate the scientific viability of a time traveling, space-bending police box that's bigger on the inside.

2.title: The Grandfather Episode
2.plot: Chelsea and Roe question the consequences to the space-time continuum of traveling back in time, killing one's own grandfather, and preventing oneself from ever being born.

3.title: The Apollo Episode
3.plot: Did NASA fake the Apollo moon landings? Chelsea and Roe give the conspiracy theorists their day in court.

4.title: The Sonic Screwdriver Episode
4.plot: At the special request of Quantum Theory fan Steve Cain, Chelsea and Roe debate the question of whether the Doctor's sonic screwdriver has any foundation in the laws of physics.

imdb.plot outline: Quantum Theory is the story of Chelsea and Roe, two brilliant, snarky women of science who develop a prototype with the power to alter reality... until it's snatched from under them by LDI, a ruthless and powerful defense contractor. With reality itself under the control of a corporate military superpower, can Chelsea and Roe take back their technology and their world? Before that happens, however... Chelsea and Roe will get to the bottom of science and technology's most pressing issues! Did NASA fake the moon landings? Can you make a police box fly through space and time? Can the right mathematical equation indeed predict the future, or does free will screw everything up? Only through the diligent research, the sharp debating skills, and the pouty footstomping of future Drs. Chelsea Barrington and Gertrude Monroe will answers be revealed! Featuring characters from the upcoming feature film Quantum Theory, "SASSxACCELERATION" is a mocumentary college podcast in which future mad scientists Chelsea Barrington and Gertrude Monroe debate and debunk the science of pop culture and modern mythology.
imdb.title: Quantum Theory: SASSxACCELERATION
plot: Future mad scientists Chelsea Barrington and Gertrude Monroe debate and debunk the science of pop culture and modern mythology.::Tennyson E. Stead
